manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description:
Economic models for oil and gas projects.

REQUIRES A LICENSE TO RUN
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: au.com.newwavegeo.graphics > 1.0.8, au.com.newwavegeo.mathlib > 1.0.6, au.com.newwavegeo.peteng > 1.0.1, au.com.newwavegeo.pyruscore > 1.0.15, javax.help > 2.0.5, javax.measure > 0.9.4, javolution > 5.4.3, org.apache.commons > 1.1.7, org.jfree.chart > 1.0.19, org.joda.time > 2.0, org.jscience > 4.3.1, org.openide.awt > 7.31.2, org.openide.dialogs > 7.20.1, org.openide.modules > 7.73, org.openide.util > 8.15.1, org.openide.util.lookup > 8.59, org.openide.util.ui > 9.13

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Resourceful allows for sophisticated, yet fast estimation of resources for a petroleum prospect or field. The module allows for creation of layered static models based on structure maps, and log interpretations that have been created using other tools. PVT fluid properties and material balance are also implemented so that a basic, but robust, recoverable estimate can be determined. Whilst the approach is not a direct replacement for a numerical simulator, it could justifiably be argued that if results are calibrated through other methods, then this approach is a very useful approach for sensitivity studies that embrace the full spectrum of a development from subsurface resource estimation, through capital cost estimation and production forecasts to economic analysis.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description:
Conversion of image data into digital data. Current implementation includes support for conversion of scanned black and white seismic sections (variable area or variable area plus wiggle) into SEG-Y format. Conversion is able to handle traces displayed with and without troughs provided peaks are displayed. Tools to convert high resolution colour photos into a suitable black and white format that can then be used for the conversion process are also included.

REQUIRES A LICENSE TO RUN
